title: Not bad
review:
Considering the 2.5 mill budget this movie was not as bad as the ratings would make you believe. The acting was fairly decent and the story line made sense even if you could predict the twist.

Not a bad time killer

5.9

title: Order and Chaos
review:
Jude (Katherine Hughes) aspires to be a violinist who can win the FAC fellowship. Emily Foster (Jordan Salmon) the previous winner fell off a building in the opening scene. Jude lives with two other co-eds and a couple of guys live next door. Everything is fairly normal except there is some stalking going on and Things become confused and unclear as we weave into the twisted ending. The producers of this film also did 'Nightmare on Elm Street." They managed to plug that film in this one.

The film felt too much like a made-for-TV production including commercial breakpoints. Nice twist at the end, but the story and plot don't hook.

Guide: F-word. Brief sex and brief nudity (Sonoya Mizuno Ex-Machina)
